messages.subject: Re: small epiphany
messages.msgSnippet: Isn t it great when that lightbulb goes off in our heads? :-) You re on your way. It s a good feeling. :-) ~ Joanne ~ Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (10) &
messages.messageBody:
Isn't it great when that lightbulb goes off in our heads? :-) You're
on your way. It's a good feeling. :-)

~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (10) & Cimion (13)
Adopted into our hearts October 30, 2003
http://anunschoolinglife.blogspot.com/
http://foreverparents.com



--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "aroundthemilkyway"
<petalpollen@...> wrote:
>
> realized this... when i wake up in the morning i need to ask the
girls
> what they want to do with the day rather than thinking about what
i
> need to accomplish....now i will be able to accomplish "this or
that"
> as they will often desire to play with dolls, do a puzzle, watch a
> movie, ride scooters, or play a computer game just by themselves
in
> which case i can work on the things i would like to
accomplish....BUT
> realizing that not everyday will i get that done and it
is 'learning
> all the time' to put them first and play, explore, read, scoot,
watch
> or dig *with* them if and when they desire that!!
>
> i know....duh, but i have had the tendency to "get my stuff done
> first" and then....blah blah blah.
>
> yet another little leaf turned over in this freedom learning
journey.
>

messages.subject: small epiphany
messages.msgSnippet: realized this... when i wake up in the morning i need to ask the girls what they want to do with the day rather than thinking about what i need to
messages.messageBody:
realized this... when i wake up in the morning i need to ask the girls
what they want to do with the day rather than thinking about what i
need to accomplish....now i will be able to accomplish "this or that"
as they will often desire to play with dolls, do a puzzle, watch a
movie, ride scooters, or play a computer game just by themselves in
which case i can work on the things i would like to accomplish....BUT
realizing that not everyday will i get that done and it is 'learning
all the time' to put them first and play, explore, read, scoot, watch
or dig *with* them if and when they desire that!!

i know....duh, but i have had the tendency to "get my stuff done
first" and then....blah blah blah.

yet another little leaf turned over in this freedom learning journey.
